68 // see https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/More_C%2B%2B_Idioms/Member_Detector
69 
73 #define GENERATE_HAS_MEMBER(Member) \
74  template <typename T, typename Enabler = void> \
75  class __has_member_##Member : public std::false_type {}; \
76  template <typename T> \
77  class __has_member_##Member< \
78  T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_class<T>::value || \
79  std::is_union<T>::value>::type> { \
80  using Yes = char[2]; \
81  using No = char[1]; \
82  \
83  struct Fallback { \
84  int Member; \
85  }; \
86  struct Derived : T, Fallback {}; \
87  \
88  template <class U> \
89  static No& test(decltype(U::Member)*); \
90  template <typename U> \
91  static Yes& test(U*); \
92  \
93  public: \
94  static constexpr bool value = \
95  sizeof(test<Derived>(nullptr)) == sizeof(Yes); \
96  }; \
97  \
98  template <class T> \
99  struct has_member_##Member \
100  : public std::integral_constant<bool, __has_member_##Member<T>::value> { \
101  };
102 
106 #define GENERATE_HAS_MEMBER_TYPE(Type) \
107  template <typename T, typename Enabler = void> \
108  class __has_member_type_##Type : public std::false_type {}; \
109  template <typename T> \
110  class __has_member_type_##Type< \
111  T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_class<T>::value || \
112  std::is_union<T>::value>::type> { \
113  using Yes = char[2]; \
114  using No = char[1]; \
115  \
116  struct Fallback { \
117  struct Type {}; \
118  }; \
119  struct Derived : T, Fallback {}; \
120  \
121  template <class U> \
122  static No& test(typename U::Type*); \
123  template <typename U> \
124  static Yes& test(U*); \
125  \
126  public: \
127  static constexpr bool value = \
128  sizeof(test<Derived>(nullptr)) == sizeof(Yes); \
129  }; \
130  \
131  template <class T> \
132  struct has_member_type_##Type \
133  : public std::integral_constant<bool, \
134  __has_member_type_##Type<T>::value> {}; \
135  \
136  template <class T> \
137  constexpr const bool has_member_type_##Type##_v = \
138  has_member_type_##Type<T>::value;
139 
148 #define GENERATE_HAS_MEMBER_FUNCTION(Member) \
149  template <typename T, typename Result, typename... Args> \
150  class __has_member_function_##Member { \
151  using Yes = char; \
152  using No = int; \
153  template <typename U, Result (U::*)(Args...)> \
154  struct Check; \
155  template <typename U, Result (U::*)(Args...) const> \
156  struct CheckConst; \
157  template <typename U> \
158  static Yes test_const(CheckConst<U, &U::Member>*); \
159  template <typename U> \
160  static No test_const(...); \
161  template <typename U> \
162  static Yes test_nonconst(Check<U, &U::Member>*); \
163  template <typename U> \
164  static No test_nonconst(...); \
165  \
166  public: \
167  static constexpr const bool value = \
168  sizeof(test_const<T>(0)) == sizeof(Yes) || \
169  (!std::is_const<T>::value ? sizeof(test_nonconst<T>(0)) == sizeof(Yes) \
170  : false); \
171  }; \
172  template <class T, typename Result, typename... Args> \
173  struct has_member_function_##Member \
174  : public std::integral_constant< \
175  bool, __has_member_function_##Member<T, Result, Args...>::value> { \
176  }; \
177  \
178  template <class T, typename Result, typename... Args> \
179  constexpr const bool has_member_function_##Member##_v = \
180  has_member_function_##Member<T, Result, Args...>::value;
181 
190 #define GENERATE_HAS_MEMBER_FUNCTION_ANYRETURN(Member) \
191  template <typename T, typename... Args> \
192  class __has_member_function_##Member##_anyreturn { \
193  using Yes = char; \
194  using No = int; \
195  template <typename U, typename... Args_> \
196  static auto func(void*) \
197  -> decltype(std::add_pointer_t<decltype(std::declval<U>().Member( \
198  std::declval<Args_>()...))>{}, \
199  Yes{}); \
200  template <typename U, typename... Args_> \
201  static No func(...); \
202  \
203  public: \
204  static constexpr const bool value = \
205  sizeof(func<T, Args...>(0)) == sizeof(Yes); \
206  }; \
207  template <class T, typename... Args> \
208  struct has_member_function_##Member##_anyreturn \
209  : public std::integral_constant< \
210  bool, \
211  __has_member_function_##Member##_anyreturn<T, Args...>::value> {}; \
212  \
213  template <class T, typename... Args> \
214  constexpr const bool has_member_function_##Member##_anyreturn_v = \
215  has_member_function_##Member##_anyreturn<T, Args...>::value;
216 
223 #define GENERATE_IS_FREE_FUNCTION_ANYRETURN(Function) \
224  template <typename... Args> \
225  class __is_free_function_##Function##_anyreturn { \
226  using Yes = char; \
227  using No = int; \
228  template <typename... Args_> \
229  static auto func(void*) -> decltype( \
230  std::add_pointer_t<decltype(Function(std::declval<Args_>()...))>{}, \
231  Yes{}); \
232  template <typename...> \
233  static No func(...); \
234  \
235  public: \
236  static constexpr const bool value = \
237  sizeof(func<Args...>(0)) == sizeof(Yes); \
238  }; \
239  template <typename... Args> \
240  struct is_free_function_##Function##_anyreturn \
241  : public std::integral_constant< \
242  bool, __is_free_function_##Function##_anyreturn<Args...>::value> { \
243  }; \
244  \
245  template <typename... Args> \
246  constexpr const bool is_free_function_##Function##_anyreturn_v = \
247  is_free_function_##Function##_anyreturn<Args...>::value;
248 
252 #define GENERATE_IS_FREE_FUNCTION_STD_ANYRETURN(Function) \
253  template <typename... Args> \
254  class __is_free_function_std_##Function##_anyreturn { \
255  using Yes = char; \
256  using No = int; \
257  template <typename... Args_> \
258  static auto func(void*) \
259  -> decltype(std::add_pointer_t<decltype( \
260  ::std::Function(std::declval<Args_>()...))>{}, \
261  Yes{}); \
262  template <typename...> \
263  static No func(...); \
264  \
265  public: \
266  static constexpr const bool value = \
267  sizeof(func<Args...>(0)) == sizeof(Yes); \
268  }; \
269  template <typename... Args> \
270  struct is_free_function_std_##Function##_anyreturn \
271  : public std::integral_constant< \
272  bool, \
273  __is_free_function_std_##Function##_anyreturn<Args...>::value> {}; \
274  \
275  template <typename... Args> \
276  constexpr const bool is_free_function_std_##Function##_anyreturn_v = \
277  is_free_function_std_##Function##_anyreturn<Args...>::value;

348 template <typename>
349 struct is_type : public std::true_type {};
352 template <typename T>
353 constexpr const bool is_type_v = is_type<T>::value;

360 template <typename T, typename = void>
361 struct is_complete_type : std::false_type {};
362 
363 template <>
364 struct is_complete_type<void> : std::false_type {};

366 template <typename T>
367 struct is_complete_type<T, decltype(void(sizeof(T)))> : std::true_type {};

391 #if !defined(__INTEL_COMPILER_BUILD_DATE)
398 template <typename From, typename To, typename Enabler = void>
399 struct has_conversion_operator : std::false_type {};
400 
401 template <typename From, typename To>
402 struct has_conversion_operator<
403  From, To,
404  typename std::enable_if<
405  is_type<decltype(std::declval<From>().operator To())>::value>::type>
406  : std::true_type {};
407 
408 template <typename From, typename To>
409 struct has_conversion_operator<
410  From, To,
411  typename std::enable_if<
412  is_type<decltype(std::declval<From>().operator To&())>::value>::type>
413  : std::true_type {};
414 #else
415 template <typename From, typename To>
416 struct has_conversion_operator {
417  /*
418  * see
419  * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/87372/check-if-a-class-has-a-member-function-of-a-given-signature#answer-10707822
420  * this works for icc and all other compilers tested:
421  * <iframe width="800px" height="200px"

423  */
424 
425  /* operator has correct sig */
426  template <typename A>
427  static std::true_type test(To (A::*)() const) {
428  return std::true_type();
429  }
430 
431  /* operator exists */
432  template <typename A>
433  static decltype(test(&A::operator To)) test(decltype(&A::operator To),
434  void*) {
435  /* Operator exists. What about sig? */
436  typedef decltype(test(&A::operator To)) return_type;
437  return return_type();
438  }
439 
440  /* operator does not exist */
441  template <typename A>
442  static std::false_type test(...) {
443  return std::false_type();
444  }
445 
446  /* This will be either `std::true_type` or `std::false_type` */
447  typedef decltype(test<From>(0, 0)) type;
448 
449  static const bool value = type::value; /* Which is it? */
450 };
451 #endif
452 
455 template <class From, class To>
456 constexpr const bool has_conversion_operator_v =
457  has_conversion_operator<From, To>::value;
458 
462 template <class From, class To>
463 struct is_explicitly_convertible : public std::is_constructible<To, From> {};
464 
467 template <class From, class To>
468 constexpr const bool is_explicitly_convertible_v =
469  is_explicitly_convertible<From, To>::value;
470 
475 template <class From, class To>
476 struct is_implicitly_convertible : public std::is_convertible<From, To> {};
477 
480 template <class From, class To>
481 constexpr const bool is_implicitly_convertible_v =
482  is_implicitly_convertible<From, To>::value;
483 
488 template <class From, class To>
489 struct is_convertible
490  : public std::integral_constant<
491  bool, is_implicitly_convertible<From, To>::value ||
492  is_explicitly_convertible<From, To>::value> {};
493 
496 template <class From, class To>
497 constexpr const bool is_convertible_v = is_convertible<From, To>::value;
498 
499 template <typename T, typename Enabler = void>
500 struct eval_trait_base {
501  typedef T type;
502  static constexpr bool is_consumable = false;
503  static constexpr bool nonblocking = false;
504 }; // struct eval_trait
505 
506 template <typename T>
507 struct eval_trait_base<
508  T,
509  typename std::enable_if<
510  has_member_type_eval_type<T>::value &&
511  (detail::is_explicitly_convertible<T, typename T::eval_type>::value ||
512  detail::is_explicitly_convertible<
513  T, madness::Future<typename T::eval_type>>::value ||
514  detail::is_implicitly_convertible<T, typename T::eval_type>::value ||
515  detail::is_implicitly_convertible<
516  T, madness::Future<typename T::eval_type>>::value)>::type> {
517  typedef typename T::eval_type type;
518  static constexpr bool is_consumable = false;
519  static constexpr bool nonblocking =
520  detail::is_explicitly_convertible<
521  T, madness::Future<typename T::eval_type>>::value ||
522  detail::is_implicitly_convertible<
523  T, madness::Future<typename T::eval_type>>::value;
524 }; // struct eval_trait
525 
526 } // namespace detail
527 
529 
539 template <typename T>
540 struct eval_trait : public TiledArray::detail::eval_trait_base<T> {};

549 struct is_lazy_tile
550  : public std::integral_constant<
551  bool, !std::is_same<T, typename eval_trait<T>::type>::value> {};

558 constexpr const bool is_lazy_tile_v = is_lazy_tile<T>::value;

570 struct is_consumable_tile
571  : public std::integral_constant<bool, !is_lazy_tile<T>::value> {};

585 struct is_complex : public std::false_type {};

587 template <typename T>
588 struct is_complex<std::complex<T>> : public std::true_type {};

592 constexpr const bool is_complex_v = is_complex<T>::value;

594 template <typename T>
595 struct is_numeric : public std::is_arithmetic<T> {};
596 
597 template <typename T>
598 struct is_numeric<std::complex<T>> : public is_numeric<T> {};
599 
600 template <>
601 struct is_numeric<bool> : public std::false_type {};

604 template <typename T>
605 constexpr const bool is_numeric_v = is_numeric<T>::value;

607 template <typename T>
608 struct is_scalar : public is_numeric<T> {};

644  : public std::integral_constant<bool, is_lazy_tile<T>::value &&
645  (!is_array_tile<T>::value)> {
646 }; // struct is_non_array_lazy_tile

652  is_non_array_lazy_tile<T>::value;

663 template <typename T, typename Enabler = void>
664 struct numeric_type;
665 
666 template <typename T>
667 struct numeric_type<T, typename std::enable_if<is_numeric_v<T>>::type> {
668  typedef T type;
669 };
670 
671 template <typename T>
672 struct numeric_type<
673  T, typename std::enable_if<has_member_type_value_type<T>::value &&
674  (!is_lazy_tile<T>::value) &&
675  (!is_numeric_v<T>)>::type>
676  : public numeric_type<typename T::value_type> {};
677 
678 template <typename T>
679 struct numeric_type<T, typename std::enable_if<is_lazy_tile<T>::value &&
680  !is_numeric_v<T>>::type>
681  : public numeric_type<typename eval_trait<T>::type> {};
682 
683 template <typename T, int Rows, int Cols, int Opts, int MaxRows, int MaxCols>
684 struct numeric_type<Eigen::Matrix<T, Rows, Cols, Opts, MaxRows, MaxCols>, void>
685  : public numeric_type<typename Eigen::Matrix<T, Rows, Cols, Opts, MaxRows,
686  MaxCols>::Scalar> {};
687 
688 template <typename T, int Rows, int Cols, int Opts, int MaxRows, int MaxCols>
689 struct numeric_type<Eigen::Array<T, Rows, Cols, Opts, MaxRows, MaxCols>, void>
690  : public numeric_type<typename Eigen::Matrix<T, Rows, Cols, Opts, MaxRows,
691  MaxCols>::Scalar> {};
692 
693 template <typename PlainObjectType, int MapOptions, typename StrideType>
694 struct numeric_type<Eigen::Map<PlainObjectType, MapOptions, StrideType>, void>
695  : public numeric_type<PlainObjectType> {};

730 
731 template <typename T>
732 struct is_strictly_ordered_helper {
733  using Yes = char;
734  using No = int;
735  template <typename U>
736  static auto test(void*) -> decltype(
737  std::add_pointer_t<decltype(std::declval<U>() < std::declval<U>())>{},
738  Yes{});
739  template <typename...>
740  static No test(...);
741 
742  public:
743  static constexpr const bool value = sizeof(test<T>(0)) == sizeof(Yes);
744 };
745 
748 template <typename T>
749 struct is_strictly_ordered
750  : public std::integral_constant<bool,
751  is_strictly_ordered_helper<T>::value> {};
752 
754 template <typename T>
755 constexpr const bool is_strictly_ordered_v = is_strictly_ordered<T>::value;
756 
757 template <typename...>
758 struct is_integral_list_helper;
759 
760 template <typename T, typename... Ts>
761 struct is_integral_list_helper<T, Ts...> {
762  static constexpr bool value =
763  std::is_integral<T>::value && is_integral_list_helper<Ts...>::value;
764 };
765 
766 template <>
767 struct is_integral_list_helper<> {
768  static constexpr bool value = true;
769 };
770 
774 template <typename... Ts>
775 struct is_integral_list
776  : std::conditional<(sizeof...(Ts) > 0ul), is_integral_list_helper<Ts...>,
777  std::false_type>::type {};
778 
780 template <typename... Ts>
781 constexpr const bool is_integral_list_v = is_integral_list<Ts...>::value;
782 
784 
785 template <class T, class = void>
786 struct is_tuple_ : std::false_type {};
787 template <class T>
788 struct is_tuple_<
789  T, typename std::enable_if<(std::tuple_size<T>::value >= 0)>::type>
790  : std::true_type {};
793 template <class T>
794 struct is_tuple : is_tuple_<T> {};
795 
797 template <typename T>
798 constexpr const bool is_tuple_v = is_tuple<T>::value;
799 
800 template <class T, class = void>
801 struct is_integral_pair_ : std::false_type {};
802 template <class T1, class T2>
803 struct is_integral_pair_<
804  std::pair<T1, T2>,
805  typename std::enable_if<std::is_integral<T1>::value &&
806  std::is_integral<T2>::value>::type>
807  : std::true_type {};
812 template <class T>
813 struct is_integral_pair : is_integral_pair_<T> {};
814 
816 template <typename T>
817 constexpr const bool is_integral_pair_v = is_integral_pair<T>::value;
818 
820 
821 template <typename...>
822 struct is_integral_pair_list_helper;
823 
824 template <typename T, typename... Ts>
825 struct is_integral_pair_list_helper<T, Ts...> {
826  static constexpr bool value =
827  is_integral_pair<T>::value && is_integral_pair_list_helper<Ts...>::value;
828 };
829 
830 template <>
831 struct is_integral_pair_list_helper<> {
832  static constexpr bool value = true;
833 };
834 
838 template <typename... Ts>
839 struct is_integral_pair_list
840  : std::conditional<(sizeof...(Ts) > 0ul),
841  is_integral_pair_list_helper<Ts...>,
842  std::false_type>::type {};
843 
846 template <typename... Ts>
847 constexpr const bool is_integral_pair_list_v =
848  is_integral_pair_list<Ts...>::value;
849 
853 template <typename T>
854 struct is_integral_tuple : std::false_type {};
855 template <typename... Ts>
856 struct is_integral_tuple<std::tuple<Ts...>> : is_integral_list<Ts...> {};
857 
859 template <typename T>
860 constexpr const bool is_integral_tuple_v = is_integral_tuple<T>::value;
861 
863 template <typename T>
864 struct remove_cvr {
865  typedef typename std::remove_cv<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::type
866  type;
867 };
868 
870 template <bool B, typename T>
871 using const_if_t = typename std::conditional<B, const T, T>::type;
872 
873 template <typename T, typename Enabler = void>
874 struct param {
875  typedef
876  typename std::add_lvalue_reference<typename std::add_const<T>::type>::type
877  type;
878 };
879 
880 template <typename T>
881 struct param<T, typename std::enable_if<is_numeric_v<T>>::type> {
882  typedef typename std::add_const<T>::type type;
883 };
884 
885 template <typename T>
886 struct param<T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_reference<T>::value>::type> {
887  typedef T type;
888 };
889 
890 template <typename T>
891 struct param<T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_pointer<T>::value>::type> {
892  typedef typename std::add_const<T>::type type;
893 };
894 
895 template <typename U>
896 using param_type = typename param<U>::type;
897 
898 struct non_iterator_tag {};
899 
900 template <typename T, typename Enabler = void>
901 struct is_iterator : public std::false_type {
902  typedef non_iterator_tag iterator_category;
903 };
904 
905 template <typename T>
906 struct is_iterator<T, typename std::enable_if<
907  has_member_type_iterator_category<T>::value>::type>
908  : public std::true_type {
909  typedef typename std::iterator_traits<T>::iterator_category iterator_category;
910 };
911 
912 template <typename T>
913 struct is_iterator<T*, void> : std::true_type {
914  typedef std::random_access_iterator_tag iterator_category;
915 };
916 
917 template <typename T>
918 struct is_iterator<const T*, void> : std::true_type {
919  typedef std::random_access_iterator_tag iterator_category;
920 };
921 
922 template <typename T>
923 struct is_iterator<T* const, void> : std::true_type {
924  typedef std::random_access_iterator_tag iterator_category;
925 };
926 
927 template <typename T>
928 struct is_iterator<const T* const, void> : std::true_type {
929  typedef std::random_access_iterator_tag iterator_category;
930 };
931 
932 template <typename T>
933 struct is_input_iterator
934  : public std::is_base_of<std::input_iterator_tag,
935  typename is_iterator<T>::iterator_category> {};
936 
937 template <typename T>
938 struct is_output_iterator
939  : public std::is_base_of<std::output_iterator_tag,
940  typename is_iterator<T>::iterator_category> {};
941 
942 template <typename T>
943 struct is_forward_iterator
944  : public std::is_base_of<std::forward_iterator_tag,
945  typename is_iterator<T>::iterator_category> {};
946 
947 template <typename T>
948 struct is_bidirectional_iterator
949  : public std::is_base_of<std::bidirectional_iterator_tag,
950  typename is_iterator<T>::iterator_category> {};
951 
952 template <typename T>
953 struct is_random_iterator
954  : public std::is_base_of<std::random_access_iterator_tag,
955  typename is_iterator<T>::iterator_category> {};
956 
957 // Type traits used to determine the result of arithmetic operations between
958 // two types.
959 
960 template <typename Scalar1, typename Scalar2>
961 using add_t = decltype(std::declval<Scalar1>() + std::declval<Scalar2>());
962 
963 template <typename Scalar1, typename Scalar2>
964 using subt_t = decltype(std::declval<Scalar1>() - std::declval<Scalar2>());
965 
966 template <typename Scalar1, typename Scalar2>
967 using mult_t = decltype(std::declval<Scalar1>() * std::declval<Scalar2>());
968 
969 template <typename T>
970 struct is_array : public std::false_type {};
971 
972 template <typename T, typename P>
973 struct is_array<DistArray<T, P>> : public std::true_type {};
974 
975 template <typename T>
976 using trange_t = typename T::trange_type;
977 
978 template <typename T>
979 using shape_t = typename T::shape_type;
980 
981 template <typename T>
982 using pmap_t = typename T::pmap_interface;
983 
984 template <typename T>
985 using policy_t = typename T::policy_type;
986 
990 template <typename Base, typename Derived>
991 struct is_same_or_derived
992  : std::conditional<
993  std::is_base_of<Base, typename std::decay<Derived>::type>::value,
994  std::true_type, std::false_type>::type {};
995 
997 
998 template <typename T>
999 struct is_pair : public std::false_type {};
1000 
1001 template <typename T1, typename T2>
1002 struct is_pair<std::pair<T1, T2>> : public std::true_type {};
1003 
1005 // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51187974/can-stdis-invocable-be-emulated-within-c11
1006 
1007 template <typename F, typename... Args>
1008 struct is_invocable
1009  : std::is_constructible<
1010  std::function<void(Args...)>,
1011  std::reference_wrapper<typename std::remove_reference<F>::type>> {};
1012 
1013 template <typename R, typename F, typename... Args>
1014 struct is_invocable_r
1015  : std::is_constructible<
1016  std::function<R(Args...)>,
1017  std::reference_wrapper<typename std::remove_reference<F>::type>> {};
1018 
1019 template <typename Enabler, typename F, typename... Args>
1020 struct is_invocable_void_helper : std::false_type {};
1021 template <typename F, typename... Args>
1022 struct is_invocable_void_helper<
1023  std::enable_if_t<std::is_void<std::result_of_t<F(Args...)>>::value, void>,
1024  F, Args...> : std::true_type {};
1025 template <typename F, typename... Args>
1026 struct is_invocable_void : is_invocable_void_helper<void, F, Args...> {};
1027

1029 struct type_printer;
1030 } // namespace detail
